FacilityName: Sunoco Logistics, L.P. Fostoria East Station

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Pipeline Transportation of Refined Petroleum Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco Partners L. P. Fostoria East Station



RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



At the Sunoco Partners L. P. Fostoria East Station in Fostoria, OH, we are committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. We believe that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, we will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All Sunoco Logistics employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.



The Fostoria East Station is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of our employees, contractors and the community in which we operate. We promote health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection.  These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning.  This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Fostoria East Terminal is an on-shore, light products, bulk petroleum storage and pipeline break out facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Fostoria East, OH. Fostoria East Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in covered process areas including all Butane loading/ unloading, Butane storage vessels, pump and associated piping.  Butane is stored in three (3) 90,000 gallon cylinders and blended into Gasoline streams.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS



Our accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and

response programs help us effectively manage the hazards posed by our regulated substances to our employees, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68, and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR 1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Fostoria East Terminal:

1) Employee Participation

2) Process Safety Information

3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) with Risk Assessments

4) Standard Operating Procedures

5) EHS Operator Training

6) Contractors

7) Pre-startup Safety Review

8) Mechanical Integrity with Preventive Maintenance

9) Work Permits

10) Management of Change

11) EHS Accident or Potential Catastrophic Event Investigation

12) Emergency Response

13) Compliance Audits

14) Trade Secrets



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidents within the past five (5) years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The Fostoria East Terminal maintains compliance with local, state and federal regulations including OSHA 29CFR 1910.120, Oil Pollution Act of 1990 and SARA Title III.  The programs are reviewed and updated on an annual basis, or more often if required.  Our Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility.  These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies. The Programs address the aspects of emergency response including:

-    Information on emergency organization (Incident Command System), including roles and responsibilities of personnel responding to the incident

-    Procedures for notifying employees that a release has occurred

-    Procedures for plant evacuation and accounting of personn

el

-    Procedures to notify local emergency response organizations and other appropriate authorities that a release has occurred

-    Guidance on proper first aid and medical treatment for exposures

-    Procedures for post incident cleanup and decontamination



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



We are continually striving to make the Fostoria East Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for our employees, our neighbors and our community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Fostoria East Terminal is to demonstrate continuous improvement in our health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, we will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of the Fostoria East Terminal and surrounding community.
